How to Install cdpr on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • cdpr

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install cdpr on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing cdpr on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall cdpr in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install cdpr, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install cdpr Using apt

To install cdpr in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install cdpr using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install cdpr

The installation of cdpr might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install cdpr Using apt-get

To install cdpr using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install cdpr.

sudo apt-get -y install cdpr

Install cdpr Using Synaptic

To install cdpr using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install cdpr on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for cdpr. This will display the cdpr package in the package window, now to install cdpr, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the cdpr package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of cdpr.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install cdpr Using aptitude

To install cdpr on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of cdpr.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install cdpr using the command aptitude install cdpr.

sudo aptitude -y install cdpr

How to Upgrade cdpr on debian

If you want to upgrade the cdpr package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade cdpr using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade cdpr to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade cdpr.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade cdpr sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade cdpr

Upgrade cdpr using Aptitude

To upgrade cdpr using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade cdpr.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade cdpr

Upgrade cdpr using Synaptic

To upgrade cdpr using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for cdpr, now right-click cdpr, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade cdpr just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall cdpr on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall cdpr from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just cdpr, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove cdpr

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of cdpr

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of cdpr you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge cdpr

Remove cdpr using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall cdpr using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for cdpr, right-click the cdpr package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall cdpr click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install cdpr on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade cdpr using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.
